clinical_study.official_title: Study to Determine the Immune Response From Broncho-alveolar Cells Against Pigeon Specific Antigens

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to establish if cells present in lung tissue during extrinsic allergic alveolitis (EAA) are able to elicit an immune response against specific antigens. The hypothesis is: cells in BAL lavage fluid from patients with EAA will be responsive to specific antigens and this response can be measured using ELISPOT.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects suffering from extrinsic allergic alveolitis caused by pigeons will undergo a broncho alveolar lavage. Cells obtained from this BAL will be used for ELISPOT technique with pigeon specific antigens

primary_outcome.measure: ELISPOT response in cells obtained from broncho-alveolar lavage
primary_outcome.description: All elispots will be performed the same day, the end point will be available the next day

secondary_outcome.measure: Elispot response in cells from blood
secondary_outcome.description: ELispots will be performed the same day as blood collection, results will be available the next day

arm_group.description: subject with BAL because of diseases not suspected to be EAA
Bird fanciers with a typical clinical presentation suspected for pigeon induced EAA

biospec_descr.textblock: Cells obtained from Broncho alveolar lavage and blood collection

study_pop.textblock: Patients suspected to have pigeon induced extrinsic allergic alveolitis will be recruited by advertisment in bird fanciers journals. Controls will be patients at the department of pulmonology and tuberculosis needing examination for other reasons

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- suspicion of pigeon induced extrinsic alveolitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- use of oral steroids
- unable to give informed consent
- age below 18
